revised_title: Observations on Cataract Surgery and the Nature of Cataracts
tldr: In this letter, Signor Antonio Benevoli describes two eye surgeries where cataracts were removed, and examines the resulting eye samples. He finds no evidence of a membranous pellicle in the eyes, and instead discovers that the cataracts were caused by a preternatural opacity in the crystalline humor. He also discusses the limitations of the needle technique used in cataract surgery.
